experience: You and Dr. DARRELL both know Eric Keosky-Smith, Ed Nusbaum, and 41 others

R4 Ventures LLC helps Data Center Owners and Operators to increase revenue and reduce the need for data center new build CAPEX or new facility commissioning  while lowering cooling system energy costs and lowering the data center’s PUE by applying a Real Time Data Center Cooling System (RTDCCS) solution to 10 to 30% of a legacy data center’s white space.

R4 Ventures LLC is  currently commercializing its patent portfolio through Engineering Know-How Licensing Agreements. The R4V business model is one of licensing the patents and know-how through our custom websites, Green Cooling Platform as a Service (http://www.gcpaas.com/) and Green Data Center Platform as a Service (http://www.gdcpaas.com/),  which will design, size and select components, develop complete specifications, calculate energy usage, price the system, compare energy savings between us and competitive systems, and generate a preliminary proposal. When customers and/or licensees agree to a formal proposal, all the website generated design data will be sent to a pre-qualified and licensed Mechanical Engineer and Mechanical Contractor to draw and stamp the system and provide formal proposals through our websites to the customer for approval and contract. Our websites will be accessed for a fee by licensees i.e. data center owners/operators, building owners, plant mechanical engineers, mechanical engineers, mechanical contractors, HVAC contractors, and companies providing process cooling needs to utilities and oil and gas companies, etc, and will be reimbursed to licensees through royalty fee credits.
Commercial Real Estate, Performing and Non Performing Notes, and Land Development
D L Richardson Development Group LLC

The Company has been providing specialized marketing and financial consulting services to small and medium-sized sized businesses for 15 years.  Darrell is a financial consultant, real estate executive, partner in several real estate development companies specializing in hospitality projects.
Company is focused on selling distressed Commercial Real Estate assets and notes utilizing custom designed programs.
Sterling Pines Private Residences Riding Club and Ranch Club

Sterling Pines Privates Residences is an equestrian based fractional ownership condominium community in the ponderosa pines mountain community of Flagstaff AZ providing Phoenix / Valley of the Sun horse owner/equestrian families, equine club members and active outdoor recreation focused families with second home and/or vacation opportunities.   We are offering 1/6th fractional ownership interest (8 weeks of usage per year) in each unit on the 40 total unit project, which consists of 20 two and 20 three bedroom fully furnished units with garages provided.  The Privates Residences offer the perfect second home to return to after a day of equestrian training, horseback riding, golfing, hiking, mountain biking, snow skiing, cross country skiing, or exploring the Coconino National Forest on horseback, mountain bikes or just hiking.
Accepted appointment as Vice-Chairman, Research Department and Ad-Hoc Committee Board of Regents January 2015

AATC University Vision - To enlist, educate, and deliver transitioning military veterans, and data center professionals into careers in the mission critical industry. The AATC University is actively involved to enhance the understanding of ISO 50001, and a consortium of other regulatory compliance initiatives for data center owners/operators, designers and builders, so that they can reduce costs & liabilities, improve their environmental impact, and increase their profitability.

Darrell has the mind of a strategist, but matches this with execution skills of great precision and outstanding analytical capabilities. He has the ability to effectively get to the bottom of complex situations quickly and to identify the correct solutions to solve challenges, organisational requirements, operational execution or optimization of profitability. He is an approachable, amusing and highly engaging blue-chip professional.

summary: R4 Ventures LLC (R4V), through focused engineering, research and development, is using the earth’s natural water cycle and abundant renewable resources to provide new innovative energy and environmental technologies and systems that produce significant reductions in energy usage and green house gas emissions. Our first two patents have been combined to create a REAL TIME DATA CENTER COOLING SYSTEM.Current technologies to be licensed to interested third parties: 1.) NEW ADVANCED MULTI-PURPOSE MULTISTAGE EVAPORATIVE COLD WATER/COLD AIR GENERATING AND SUPPLY SYSTEM (MECS) for process cooling applications scalable from 5 to over 1000 tons of comparable mechanical refrigeration saving 60 to 80% on cooling energy costs; and 2.) REAL TIME INDIVIDUAL ELECTRONIC ENCLOSURE COOLING SYSTEM (ISECS)providing real time data center rack cooling based on real time cooling of the IT processing load while eliminating hot isles and cold isles and maintaining + or - 1 degree F at any point within the Data Center. Applications include:- Data Centers – Real Time Data Center Cooling System (MECS + ISECS)- Semiconductor Manufacturing - Real Time Electronic Enclosure Cooling System (MECS + ISECS)- Commercial/Industrial Buildings – MECS- Inlet Air Cooling for Nat Gas Turbines/CHP Systems – MECS- Inlet Air Cooling for Compressed Air Systems - MECS- Process Cooling Water for Industrial & Food Processing Plants - MECSThe  US Patent and Trademark Office published US Patent 8,852,204 on October 14, 2014 on our Real Time Individual Electronic Enclosure Cooling System. US Patent Number 8,899,061 was published on December 2, 2014 on our Advanced Multi-Purpose, Multi-stage Evaporative Cold Water/Cold Air Generating and Supply System.  Click on the patent name in the patent section below to view full published document.Specialties: Data Center Cooling, Data Center Shared Tenant Services in Commercial High Rise Buildings, Turbine Inlet Cooling, Inlet Air Cooling for Compressed Air Systems.
name: Dr. DARRELL RICHARDSON, Mission Critical Ops
